titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Don Byrd Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:22

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, sketchbooks, notebooks, photographs, audiovisual materials, and other papers that document the work and social circle of poet Don Byrd. Notable correspondents include Charles Bernstein, Clayton Eshleman, Susan Howe, Gerrit Lansing, Paul Metcalf, and Jed Rasula. Photographs include color and black and white portraits of Byrd and other poets. Audiovisual materials consist of audiorecordings made by Byrd of poets including John Ashbery, Charles Bernstein, Gerrit Lansing, Paul Metcalf, Charles Olson, and others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Correspondence, 1953-2002. II. Sketchbooks and notebooks, 1967-2010. III. Photographs, 1970s-1980s. IV. Other papers, 1970s-2010. V. Audiovisual materials, 1960s-1990s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 14-16 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Don Byrd is an American poet, sound artist, and professor of English at the State University of New York at Albany.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Granary Books, Inc. on the Alfred Z. Baker, Jr. Fund and the Donald Windham-Sandy Campbell Collection Endowment Fund, 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Don Byrd Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes "Day of Atonement for Indiana University, Yom Kippur 1977" inscribed to Don Byrd.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Court of the Half-King inscribed; Remembering the Future; The Day I Found Marco Polo Outside of Cleveland; and manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Bean News, Rolling Stock and manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the printed works Die Ewigkeit altert and Period Piece.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an enscribed copy of At Large.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed and inscribed material included; Archipelago, Etudes. Also includes manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes manuscripts and anotated printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Books by Charles Olson, annotated by Don Byrd.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes poetry button and various manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes carbon copies of Don Byrd's responses, as well as 4 issues of The Well Tempered Wreader, May-July 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes manuscript and Woodstock Journal, October 4-18, 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes carbon copies from Don Byrd, and manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Smoky the Bear Sutra, Cottonwood Review, 1972.

did.unittitle: Strauss, David Levi - "Double Portrait of Don & Pierre [Joris], in Darkness & in Light," photograph

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Palabra e Hilo / Word & Thread, Morning Star Publications, 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes An noun cing / The Collected Letter's of Wolf Run (1976) and an inscribed copy of Had (1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sketchbooks and notebooks consist mostly of sketchbooks from the late 1990s and 2000s. Also included are notebooks documenting publishing, exams, and dissertations from the late 1960s through the early 1990s.

did.unittitle: Publishing record, exams and dissertations, notebooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Color and black and white photographs of poets taken by Don Byrd in the 1970s and 1980s. Photographs include portraits of William Bronk, Don Byrd (self-portrait light drawings), Margie Byrd, Clark Coolidge, Robert Duncan, Gerrit Lansing, Nancy Metcalf, Paul Metcalf, Bernadette Mayer, Tom Meyer, George Quasha, Susan Quasha, Joel Oppenheimer, Gary Synder, Lewis Warsh, and Jonathan Williams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Other papers consist of ephemera, postcards, writings, clippings, and a poster.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audiovisual materials consist of recordings made by Don Byrd of poets and friends including John Ashbery, Bruce Andrews, Charles Bernstein, Paul Blackburn, Robin Blaser, Don Byrd, Clark Coolidge, Fielding Dawson, Edward Dorn, Robert Duncan, Robert Grenier, Christer Hennix, Anselm Hollo, Ken Irby, Gerrit Lansing, Jackson MacLow, Paul Metcalf, Charles Olson, Edward Sanders, Gary Snyder, John Yau, Louis Zukofsky, and others.

did.unittitle: VHS, Video8 cassettes, and Audiotape reels

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Audiovisual material. Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
